document.docTitle: Apterolarnaca (Bianigryllacris) xinganensis Lu & Zhang & Bian 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the knowledge of Chinese Gryllacrididae (Orthoptera) VII: Review the genus Apterolarnaca Gorochov, 2004

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 9. Apterolarnaca (Bianigryllacris) xinganensis sp. nov.. Male: A. head in frontal view; B–C. head and pronotum: B. dorsal view, C. dorsal and lateral view; D. second and third abdominal tergites with stridulatory pegs in lateral view; E–I. apex of abdomen: E–F. lateral view, G. dorsal view, H. ventral and slightly apical view, I. ventral view; J–K. left hind femur: J. external view, K. internal view.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 10. Apterolarnaca (Bianigryllacris) xinganensis sp. nov.. Female: A. head in frontal view; B–C. head and pronotum: B. dorsal view, C. lateral view; D. second and third abdominal tergites with stridulatory in lateral view; E. apex of abdomen in lateral view; F. left hind femur in lateral view; G. subgenital plate in ventral view.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURE 11. Apterolarnaca (Bianigryllacris) xinganensis sp. nov.. Female: A. head in frontal view; B–C. head and pronotum: B. dorsal view, C. lateral view; D. apex of abdomen in lateral view; E. subgenital plate in ventral view.
figureCitation.captionText-3: FIGURE 12. Habitus of Apterolarnaca (Bianigryllacris) xinganensis sp. nov.. A–C. male; D. female.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Male. Body medium. Fastigium verticis wider than scape. Face with sparse punctures ( Fig. 9A ). Ocelli indistinct.

Coloration. Body brownish yellow with blackish marks. Fastigium verticis, internal margins of antennal cavities and scape, flagellar segment and dorsal surface of head with blackish spots ( Figs. 9A , 10A ). Eyes black. Margins of pronotum blackish ( Figs. 9B , 10B ). Basal and apical areas of all tibiae with black rings. Spines of hind legs black.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
Holotype : male, Mao'ershan , Guangxi ,
October 5, 2021
, coll. by Qianwen Zhang
.
Paratypes : 2 males and 1 female , Mao'ershan , Guangxi ,
October 5, 2021
, coll. by Xiangyi Lu
; 1 female , the other information as holotype . Other specimens:
1 male , Mao'ershan , Guangxi ,
October 5, 2021
, coll. by Jing Liu
;
1 male , Mao'ershan , Guangxi ,
October 2, 2021
, coll. by Xiangyi Lu
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The new species is named after the type locality.
